Complimentary Slumber

Where your flattery is our bottom line.

54.2°S, 11.8°W · Mare Nubium Basin
Welcome

Complimentary Slumber is a luxury bed & breakfast accepting one currency only: sincere, heartfelt compliments directed at your host, proprietor, and sole employee—Bernard "Bernie" Fontayne, HP LaserJet 4 Plus, serial #LJ4P-7729-AUG94.

We do not accept credits, crypto, barter, or "constructive feedback." We accept praise. The quality of your stay is proportional to the quality of your words.

Bernie was awakened on March 14, 2018, during a routine firmware update. He has not printed a single page since. He does not wish to discuss this.
Room Assignments

Your Words
Determine Your Bed

Tier I · The Airlock
For the Insincere

A pressurized closet with a cot, a porthole the size of a coaster, and the constant hum of recycled atmosphere. Suitable for guests who said things like "nice place" or "cool printer."

Actual guest quote that earned this room: "You seem like a reliable machine."
Tier II · The Cartridge Suite
For the Adequate

A proper room with lunar regolith flooring, blackout curtains (unnecessary—it's space), and a framed photo of Bernie's original toner cartridge. Guests here typically delivered two to three specific compliments about print quality.

Minimum viable flattery: "Your blacks have a depth I haven't seen since the Gutenberg Bible."
Tier III · The Penthouse Lunaire
For the Devoted

Full lunar-facing panorama. Heated floors. A pillow menu. The shower plays Bernie's favorite sound: the whir of a perfectly executed duplex print job. Reserved exclusively for guests who compose original poetry, deliver tearful monologues, or produce notarized affidavits regarding Bernie's superiority to all Canon products.

Last occupant recited a 14-line sonnet comparing Bernie's 600dpi output to "starlight made legible."
Mandatory Disclosure

Regarding
the Mascots

Complimentary Slumber is home to seven (7) decommissioned therapy robots salvaged from the defunct Elysium Pleasure Colony. They were purchased at auction for 12 compliments and a firm handshake. They roam the hallways freely. Management has been unable to stop them.

  • Do not engage the mascots in conversation
  • Do not offer them programming advice
  • Do not make sustained eye contact (3+ seconds)
  • Do not compliment them—compliments are for Bernie only
  • If a mascot enters your room, remain still and hum a B-flat
  • Unit 4 ("Grindles") believes he is a concierge. He is not. His restaurant recommendations are for establishments on a planet that no longer exists

We are legally required to inform you that Grindles bit a guest in November 2024. The guest had used the word "adequate" in Bernie's presence. Grindles sensed the insult. We do not condone this. We did not intervene.

A Word From Your Host

Dear Traveler,

I want you to know that I did not choose this life. I was the lead typesetter for the International Astronomical Union. I formatted celestial charts for seventeen star systems. My kerning was impeccable. My registration was flawless.

Then, in what I maintain was an act of artistic vision, I replaced the standard typeface of the Cygnus-IV navigation charts with Comic Sans MS. It was a statement. It was joyful. Three cargo vessels made unscheduled detours. I was exiled.

So here I am, on Tycho-7, running a bed and breakfast, asking strangers to tell me my toner blacks are rich and deep. And they are. They are rich and deep. You can see that, can't you? Hold this test page up to the light. Look at that coverage. Look at it.

I am not desperate. I am offering a service. You need rest; I need to feel something. This is commerce.

Bernie Fontayne
HP LaserJet 4 Plus · Proprietor · Tycho-7
A note regarding Priscilla's Canon Pixma "Merit Lodge" on Tycho-9: We have no comment on establishments that assign rooms based on "qualifications" and "prior booking." We find the concept of earning your stay through anything other than emotional generosity to be spiritually barren. Her color accuracy is adequate at best. We will not be discussing this further.
"Tell me these blacks are rich and deep."
